com.isbx.androidtools.ui

Class TextIconAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.widget.BaseAdapter
      • android.widget.ArrayAdapter<String>
        • com.isbx.androidtools.ui.TextIconAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Adapter, Filterable, ListAdapter, SpinnerAdapter, ThemedSpinnerAdapter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BindingTextIconAdapter

    public class TextIconAdapter
extends ArrayAdapter<String>
    An implementation of ArrayAdapter that is tailored for lists whose rows contain one image icon and one text label. This is useful for common scenarios such as nav drawers where a list of text labels is decorated with unique icons.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface android.widget.Adapter

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextIconAdapter

        public TextIconAdapter(Context context,
                       int resource,
                       int textViewId,
                       int imageViewId,
                       String[] labels,
                       TypedArray icons)
        Creates a new TextIconAdapter instance. The layout found at resource will be inflated for each View generated by this adapter. In each of these views, the TextView found with textViewId will be populated with the appropriate text from labels, and the ImageView found with imageViewId will be populated with the appropriate image resource id from icons.
        Parameters:
        context - The current Context
        resource - The resource ID for a layout file containing the layout to use when instantiating views
        textViewId - The id of the TextView within the layout resource to be populated
        imageViewId - The id of the ImageView within the layout resource to be populated
        labels - An array of Strings to use as labels for each view
        icons - A TypedArray of image resource ids to use as icons for each view

      • TextIconAdapter

        public TextIconAdapter(Context context,
                       int resource,
                       int textViewId,
                       int imageViewId,
                       int labelArrayId,
                       int iconArrayId)
        Creates a new TextIconAdapter instance. The layout found at resource will be inflated for each View generated by this adapter. In each of these views, the TextView found with textViewId will be populated with the appropriate text from the String array resource denoted by labelArrayId, and the ImageView found with imageViewId will be populated with the appropriate image resource id from the TypedArray resource denoted by iconArrayId.
        Parameters:
        context - The current Context
        resource - The resource ID for a layout file containing the layout to use when instantiating views
        textViewId - The id of the TextView within the layout resource to be populated
        imageViewId - The id of the ImageView within the layout resource to be populated
        labelArrayId - The resource ID for a String array to use as labels for each view
        iconArrayId - The resource ID for a TypedArray of images to use as icons for each view

    • Method Detail

      • getView

        public View getView(int position,
                    View convertView,
                    ViewGroup parent)
        Extends the base ArrayAdapter.getView(int, View, ViewGroup) implementation to find the ImageView with the imageViewId specified in this adapter. If the image view is not null, its source image will be set to the appropriate resource id from this adapter's iconIds array for the given position.
        Specified by:
        getView in interface Adapter
        Overrides:
        getView in class ArrayAdapter<String>
        Parameters:
        position - The position of the item within the adapter's data set of the item whose view we want.
        convertView - The old View to reuse, if possible. Note: You should check that this view is non-null and of an appropriate type before using. If it is not possible to convert this view to display the correct data, this method can create a new view. Heterogeneous lists can specify their number of view types, so that this View is always of the right type (see BaseAdapter.getViewTypeCount() and BaseAdapter.getItemViewType(int).
        parent - The ViewGroup parent that this view will eventually be attached to
        Returns:
        A View corresponding to the data at the specified position.
